studyVersion.title: Introduction to Leaving Cert Computer Science
keyIdeas: Leaving Cert Computer Science is divided into three strands: Practices and Principles, Core Concepts, and Applied Learning Tasks.
Strand 1 covers systematic problem solving and the power of computing.
Strand 2 focuses on abstraction, pattern recognition, and system description.
Strand 3 involves applied learning tasks with real-world applications.
Assessment includes a written exam and project work.
definitions: Abstraction: Simplifying complex systems by focusing on main ideas and ignoring specific details.
steps: Engage in applied learning tasks and projects.
mistakes: Confusing the three strands and their focus areas.
Overlooking the importance of abstraction in problem solving.

miniCheck.q: What are the three strands of Leaving Cert Computer Science?
miniCheck.a: Practices and Principles, Core Concepts, Applied Learning Tasks.
Simplifying complex systems by focusing on main ideas.
Through a written exam and project work.

studyVersion.memoryHook: Think of the course as a triangle: Problem Solving, Core Concepts, and Real-World Application.
